@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@

+# ==============================================================================
+"""Python helper for loading kinesis ops and kernels."""
+from __future__ import absolute_import
+from __future__ import division
+from __future__ import print_function
+
+from tensorflow.contrib.util import loader
+from tensorflow.python.platform import resource_loader
+
+_dataset_ops = loader.load_op_library(
+    resource_loader.get_path_to_datafile("../../_dataset_ops.so"))
body: Thanks @mrry. At the moment, the `//tensorflow/contrib/kinesis` build is controlled by `with_aws_support` flag. The `//tensorflow/contrib/kinesis` build is skipped with `with_aws_support=False`. So the object file will not be built in that case.
body_html: Thanks @mrry. At the moment, the //tensorflow/contrib/kinesis build is controlled by with_aws_support flag. The //tensorflow/contrib/kinesis build is skipped with with_aws_support=False. So the object file will not be built in that case.
body_text: Thanks @mrry. At the moment, the //tensorflow/contrib/kinesis build is controlled by with_aws_support flag. The //tensorflow/contrib/kinesis build is skipped with with_aws_support=False. So the object file will not be built in that case.
